Michigan Historical Collections

titlepage.titleproper:
Finding Aid for
Arthur Lyon Cross Papers, 1897-1940
titlepage.author:
Finding aid prepared by:
Michigan Historical Collections staff

did.abstract: Professor of English history at University of Michigan. Correspondence with European and American historians, publishing houses, editors of learned journals, members of his family, and friends; also manuscripts of books and articles, lecture notes, student records, business papers, personal account books, diaries, 1938-1940, with comments on world events, and miscellaneous papers; and photographs.
did.physloc: Offsite storage; prior notification required for access

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Arthur Lyon Cross and his estate (donor no. 1203). The great bulk of the collection came to the library in 1940.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Arthur Lyon Cross Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Arthur Lyon Cross was born November 14, 1873 in Portland, Maine. He graduated from Harvard College with an AB degree in 1895. While at Harvard, Cross worked with Edward Channing, continuing his studies, receiving his A.M. in 1896 and his Ph.D. in 1899. His thesis was later published as The Anglican Episcopate and the American Colonies.

Cross came to the University of Michigan in 1899 as an instructor. He was promoted to professor in 1911 and in 1916 he was appointed Richard Hudson Professor of English History. Cross was noted for his courses on English and constitutional history, and for his various writings, especially A history of England and Greater Britain and his history of St. Andrew's Church in Ann Arbor. Cross died June 21, 1940.

scopecontent.p: The Cross papers are divided into the following series: Correspondence; Miscellaneous and undated papers; Personal/Biographical; University of Michigan; Publications, articles, and related; Research and lecture materials, and Photographs.

did.unittitle: St. Andrews Episcopal Church, Ann Arbor 1918-1940
Official appointment notices from the University of Michigan 1902-1938
Biographical sketches and memorials of university personages
Papers concerning publication of his books 1905-1921
Correspondence concerning corrections for A History of England, 1915-1921
Book Reviews of A History of England, 1914
Book Reviews of the Anglican Episcopate, 1902-1903
Correspondence for the National Board for Historical Service 1917-1918
Subscriptions to the National Bibliography of Modern British History 1909-1916
Manuscript of A History of St. Andrews, Church, Ann Arbor
Lecture notes on English Constitutional History and general
Lecture notes on general English History
Portraits and informal snapshots of Cross, family members and friends
Photographs of travel 1920s to Tahiti and elsewhere
Print from wood engraving of a Chinese warrior
